010package imagingbook.pub.color.quantize;
011
012import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Locale;
016import java.util.Random;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
022import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.lib.color.RgbUtils;
025import imagingbook.pub.color.statistics.ColorHistogram;
026
027/**
028 * This class implements color quantization using k-means clustering
029 * of image pixels in RGB color space. Two modes of selecting
030 * the colors for the initial clusters are provided:
031 * (a) random sampling of the input colors,
032 * (b) using the most frequent colors.
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2017/01/04
036 */
037public class KMeansClusteringQuantizer implements ColorQuantizer {
038        
039        private final Parameters params;
040        private final float[][] colormap;
041        private final Cluster[] clusters;
042        private final double totalError;
043        
044        public enum SamplingMethod {
045                Random, Most_Frequent
046        };
047        
048        public static class Parameters {
049                /** Maximum number of quantized colors. */
050                public int maxColors = 16;
051                /** Maximum number of clustering iterations */
052                public int maxIterations = 500;
053                /** The method used for selecting the initial color samples. */
054                public SamplingMethod samplMethod = SamplingMethod.Random;
055                
056                void check() {
057                        if (maxColors < 2 || maxColors > 256 || maxIterations < 1) {
058                                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
059                        }
060                }
061        }
062        
063        // --------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        public KMeansClusteringQuantizer(ColorProcessor cp, Parameters params) {
066                this((int[]) cp.getPixels(), params);
067        }
068
069        /**
070         * Creates a new quantizer instance from the supplied sequence
071         * of color values (assumed to be ARGB-encoded integers).
072         * 
073         * @param pixels Sequence of input color values.
074         * @param params Parameter object.
075         */
076        public KMeansClusteringQuantizer(int[] pixels, Parameters params) {
077                params.check();
078                this.params = params;
079                clusters = makeClusters(pixels);
080                totalError = cluster(pixels);
081                colormap = makeColorMap();
082        }
083        
084        public KMeansClusteringQuantizer(int[] pixels) {
085                this(pixels, new Parameters());
086        }
087        
088        // --------------------------------------------------------------
089
090        private Cluster[] makeClusters(int[] pixels) {
091                int Kmax = Math.min(pixels.length, params.maxColors);
092                int[] samples = getColorSamples(pixels, Kmax);
093                int k = Math.min(samples.length, Kmax);
094                Cluster[] cls = new Cluster[k]; // create an array of K clusters
095                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
096                        cls[i] = new Cluster(samples[i]); // initialize cluster center
097                }
098                return cls; 
099        }
100        
101        /**
102         * We randomly pick k distinct colors from the original image
103         * pixels.
104         * @param pixels
105         * @param k
106         * @return
107         */
108        private int[] getColorSamples(int[] pixels, int k) {
109                switch (params.samplMethod) {
110                case Random:
111                        return getRandomColors(pixels, k);
112                case Most_Frequent:
113                        return getMostFrequentColors(pixels, k);
114                default:
115                        return null;
116                }
117        }
118
119        private int[] getRandomColors(int[] pixels, int k) {
120                Random rng = new Random();
121                Set<Integer> pixelSet = new LinkedHashSet<Integer>();
122                while (pixelSet.size() < k) {
123                        Integer next = rng.nextInt(pixels.length);
124                        int p = pixels[next];
125                        // adding to a set automatically does a containment check
126                        pixelSet.add(p);
127                }
128                int[] s = new int[k];
129                int i = 0;
130                for (Integer p : pixelSet) {
131                        s[i] = p;
132                        i++;
133                }
134                return s;
135        }
136        
137        private int[] getMostFrequentColors(int[] pixels, int k) {
138                ColorHistogram colorHist = new ColorHistogram(pixels, true);
139                k = Math.min(k, colorHist.getNumberOfColors());
140                int[] s = new int[k];
141                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
142                        s[i] = colorHist.getColor(i);
143                }
144                return s;
145        }
146        
147        private double cluster(int[] pixels) {
148                int changed = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
149                double distSum = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
150                int j = 0;
151                while (changed > 0 && j < params.maxIterations) {
152                        distSum = assignSamples(pixels);
153                        changed = updateClusters();
154                        j++;
155                }
156                return distSum;
157        }
158
159        
160        private double assignSamples(int[] pixels) {
161                double distSum = 0;
162                for (int p : pixels) {
163                        double dist = addToClosestCluster(p);
164                        distSum = distSum + dist;
165                }
166                return distSum;
167        }
168        
169        private int updateClusters() {
170                int changed = 0;
171                for (Cluster c : clusters) {
172                        changed = changed + c.upDate();
173                }
174                return changed;
175        }
176        
177        private double addToClosestCluster(int p) {
178                double minDist = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
179                Cluster closest = null;
180                for (Cluster c : clusters) {
181                        double d = c.getDistance(p);
182                        if (d < minDist) {
183                                minDist = d;
184                                closest = c;
185                        }
186                }
187                closest.addPixel(p);
188                return minDist;
189        }
190
191        private float[][] makeColorMap() {
192                List<float[]> colList = new LinkedList<>();
193                for (Cluster c : clusters) {
194                        if (!c.isEmpty()) {
195                                colList.add(c.getCenterColor());
196                        }
197                }               
198                return colList.toArray(new float[0][]);
199        }
200        
201        /**
202         * Lists the color clusters to System.out (intended for debugging only).
203         */
204        public void listClusters() {
205                for (Cluster c : clusters) {
206                        System.out.println(c.toString());
207                }
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Returns the total error of this clustering, calculated as the sum of
212         * the squared distances of the color samples to the associated cluster
213         * center. This calculation is performed during the final iteration.
214         * 
215         * @return The sum of the squared distances between samples and cluster centers.
216         */
217        public double getTotalError() {
218                return totalError;
219        }
220
221        // ------- methods required by abstract super class -----------------------
222        
223        @Override
224        public float[][] getColorMap() {
225                return colormap;
226        }
227        
228        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
229        
230        private class Cluster {
231                int sRed, sGrn, sBlu;           // RGB sum of contained pixels
232                int pCounter;                           // pixel counter, used during pixel assignment
233                int population = 0;                     // number of contained pixels
234                double cRed, cGrn, cBlu;        // center of this cluster
235
236                Cluster(int p) {
237                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
238                        cRed = rgb[0];
239                        cGrn = rgb[1];
240                        cBlu = rgb[2];
241                        reset();
242                }
243
244                public float[] getCenterColor() {
245                        return new float[] {(float)cRed, (float)cGrn, (float)cBlu};
246                }
247
248                public boolean isEmpty() {
249                        return (population == 0);
250                }
251
252                void reset() {  // Used at the start of the pixel assignment.
253                        sRed = 0;
254                        sGrn = 0;
255                        sBlu = 0;
256                        pCounter = 0;
257                }
258                
259                void addPixel(int p) {
260                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
261                        sRed += rgb[0];
262                        sGrn += rgb[1];
263                        sBlu += rgb[2];
264                        pCounter = pCounter + 1;
265                }
266                
267                /**
268                 * This method is invoked after all samples have been assigned.
269                 * It updates the cluster's center and returns true if its
270                 * population changed from the previous clustering.
271                 * @return true if the population of this cluster has changed.
272                 */
273                int upDate() {
274                        if (pCounter > 0) {
275                                double scale = 1.0 / pCounter;
276                                cRed = sRed * scale;
277                                cGrn = sGrn * scale;
278                                cBlu = sBlu * scale;
279                        }
280                        int changed = Math.abs(pCounter - population);  // change in cluster population
281                        population = pCounter;
282                        reset();
283                        return changed; 
284                }
285                
286                /**
287                 * Calculates and returns the squared Euclidean distance between the color p
288                 * and this cluster's center in RGB space.
289                 * @param p Color sample
290                 * @return Squared distance to the cluster center
291                 */
292                double getDistance(int p) {
293                        int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
294                        final double dR = rgb[0] - cRed;
295                        final double dG = rgb[1] - cGrn;
296                        final double dB = rgb[2] - cBlu;
297                        return dR * dR + dG * dG + dB * dB;
298                }
299                
300                @Override
301                public String toString() {
302                        return String.format(Locale.US, Cluster.class.getSimpleName() +
303                                        ": center=(%.1f,%.1f,%.1f), population=%d", cRed, cGrn, cBlu, population);
304                }
305        }
306        
307        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
308        
309        public static void main(String[] args) {
310//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/alps-01s.png";
311//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
312                String path = "C:/_SVN/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
313                
314//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/single-color.png";
315//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/two-colors.png";
316//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/random-colors.png";
317//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/ramp-fire.png";
318                
319                int K = 16; 
320                System.out.println("image = " + path);
321                System.out.println("K = " + K);
322
323                ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(path);
324                if (im == null) {
325                        System.out.println("could not open: " + path);
326                        return;
327                }
328                
329                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
330                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
331                
332                Parameters params = new Parameters();
333                params.maxColors = K;
334                ColorQuantizer quantizer = new KMeansClusteringQuantizer(cp, params);
335                quantizer.listColorMap();
336                
337                System.out.println("quantizing image");
338                ByteProcessor qi = quantizer.quantize(cp);
339                System.out.println("showing image");
340                (new ImagePlus("quantizez", qi)).show();
341                
342        }
343        
344} 
345
